quotes.quote: The road leading to a goal does not separate you from the destination; it is essentially a part of it.
When you live on the road, going home is a place to escape and just be with your family to unwind.
If there is a nice road to your destination, you are lucky; if there isn't any, then you are even luckier because you will have the chance to be a road-creator!
Roads are essential to any type of agricultural development.
The longer the road to love, the keener is the pleasure to be experienced by the sensitive lover.
An old road always looks richer and more beautiful than a new road because old roads have memories!

There is a road from the eye to the heart that does not go through the intellect. Men do not quarrel about the meaning of sunsets; they never dispute that the hawthorn says the best and wittiest thing about the spring.
The road may be beautiful or ugly; it may be easy or hard, smooth or rough, it doesn't matter; what matters most is where the road will take you!
I believe that all roads lead to the same place - and that is wherever all roads lead to.
The trials on the road to world harmony are no greater than the courage of those who accept the challenge.
The road to success is not a path you find but a trail you blaze.
The road reaches every place, the short cut only one.
When within yourself you find the road, the right road will open.
If the road is beautiful, walk the road slowly; be a turtle, be a snail and even better than this: Stop walking; live the road fully!
The road before us is shorter than the road behind.
The road to success is always under construction.
The road was new to me, as roads always are, going back.
The road is a word, conceived elsewhere and laid across the country in the wound prepared for it: a word made concrete and thrust among us.
Hope is like a road in the country; there was never a road, but when many people walk on it, the road comes into existence.
Whatever road you've been given, enjoy that road.
The road recedes as the traveler advances, leaving a continuous present.
There is no royal road to learning; no short cut to the acquirement of any art.
The road is long, we carry on, try to have fun in the meantime.
There are no wrong roads to anywhere.
On the roads, it is one of those 'might is right' situations. If I see cars coming, I duck out of the way.
The road to success just might be your driveway.
The middle of the road is all of the usable surface. The extremes, right and left, are in the.
A lost road will remember your footsteps because someday you may want to return, tracing the way.
There is no royal road; you've got to work a good deal harder than most people want to work.
There are so many roads you can take that will lead you the wrong way, that nobody will hear your name.
